Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory
  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    Inventory class with a LinkedList of ArrayLists to hold devices

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Inventory()
      Initializes an Inventory object with all properties specified

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addDevice​(java.lang.String name, double price, int quantity, java.lang.String category)
      Add a new device to the inventory
      void displayDevices()
      Display all devices in the inventory time complexity: O(n) of displayDevices() The displayDevices function iterates through all devices across all categories with nested loops,
      void exportInventoryReport()
      Export an inventory report to a text file time complexity: O(n) of exportInventoryReport() The exportInventoryReport function creates a new file object with the name "inventory_report.txt",
      void minPriceDevice()
      Display all devices in a specific category time complexity: O(n) of minPriceDevice() The minPriceDevice function iterates through all devices across all categories with nested loops,
      void removeDevice​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String category)
      Remove a device from the inventory
      void restockDevice​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String addOrRemove, int quantity)
      Restock a device in the inventory
      void sortDevicesByPrice()
      Sort devices by price in ascending order time complexity: O(nlogn) of sortDevicesByPrice() The sortDevicesByPrice function first creates a new list to store the sorted devices,
      double totalValue()
      Calculate the total value of the inventory time complexity: O(n) of totalValue()
      void updateDevice​(java.lang.String name, double newPrice, int newQuantity)
      updateDevice method without category parameter

                      double price,

                      java.lang.String category)
        Add a new device to the inventory
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the device
        price - the price of the device
        quantity - the quantity of the device
        category - the category of the device time complexity: O(1) of addDevice(String name, double price, int quantity, String category)

      • updateDevice

        public void updateDevice​(java.lang.String name,
                         double newPrice,
                         int newQuantity)
        updateDevice method without category parameter
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the device
        newPrice - the new price of the device
        newQuantity - the new quantity of the device time complexity: O(n) of updateDevice(String name, double newPrice, int newQuantity) The updateDevice function iterates through all devices across all categories with nested loops, but essentially performs a single pass over the total number of devices, n, in the inventory. Therefore, the time complexity of the updateDevice function is O(n).

        totalValue the total value of the inventory

        Parameters:
